sentences.english: The man looked worried because he didn't know how to sound the fire alarm.
sentences.chinese: 那個人看起來很着急，因爲他不知道怎麼弄響警鈴。

sentences.english: The clang of the firebell alarmed the village.
sentences.chinese: 火警鈴的叮噹聲驚動了全村的人。

sentences.english: While we are there, the alarm rings.
sentences.chinese: 我們在那裏的時候正好還碰上警鈴響了呢。

sentences.english: He sprang out of bed when the alarm went off.
sentences.chinese: 聽到警鈴響，他從牀上跳下來。

sentences.english: Alarms went off and the sprinkler system turned on.
sentences.chinese: 頓警鈴大響，漏水系統也啓動了。

sentences.english: A very loud security alarm immediately began to go off.
sentences.chinese: 一陣非常吵的安全警鈴馬上響起來。

definition: 38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
to restore sth to its original state
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
